intro: Cryptantha clokeyi, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and sandy plains. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its survival in harsh conditions. Cryptantha clokeyi is adapted to low water availability, with deep root systems that help it access underground moisture.
